meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) in authority, standing, or importance
meanings.sent1: The new manager is superceding the old one in leading the team.
meanings.sent2: Technology is superceding traditional methods in many industries.
meanings.sent3: The young prince joked about superceding the king in the royal chess tournament.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun supercedes the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's arrival supercedes all other attempts to save the city.

meanings.definition: To replace (something older or less effective) with something new or better
meanings.sent1: The updated software is superceding the outdated version.
meanings.sent2: The new model of the car is superceding the previous one.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor's latest creation is superceding all his previous inventions.
meanings.sent4: The fresh coat of paint supercedes the worn-out look of the room.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's talent supercedes his lack of experience in the game.
